Preferential New Fund Time Deposit Rates
We have changed the eligibility criteria to enjoy preferential new fund time deposit rates. Details can be found within the page.
Save your money for a set period of time to enjoy preferential time deposit rates across HKD, USD, RMB and designated foreign currencies.
"Eligible New Fund Amount" is the net increase in your latest total balance (across all your deposit accounts) compared to the balance as at 7 calendar days ago. This amount is calculated in HKD. If you have placed time deposit(s) with new funds in the past 7 calendar days, that time deposit amount will not be included as part of your latest total balance for calculating the Eligible New Fund Amount.
You can refer to our illustrative examples for the calculation of eligible new fund amount.
To learn more about the online offer, please refer to our Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs).

Foreign Exchange & Time Deposit Offer
Customers exchanging to currencies below and placing the fund into a 1-week or 1-month time deposit can enjoy preferential time deposit rates. Applicable to mobile banking, branch and phone banking.
From now until 30 Jan 2024, customers can enjoy a bonus deposit rate of +1.0% p.a. on top of prevailing 1-week time deposit rates when exchanging via mobile banking under this offer. Learn more

Need help?
If you are not holding an HSBC Premier or HSBC One account and you do not have an active time deposit account with us
On the HSBC HK App, under ‘Explore products and services’, you will find the option 'Account opening/ upgrade', which allows you to submit an application to open or upgrade to an HSBC Premier or HSBC One account with us (subject to individual customer eligibility).
You can then place a time deposit through our digital banking at the next business day upon successfully opening an account.
If you are new to HSBC
Download the HSBC HK App to open an HSBC account with us
For further enquiries, please contact us. 
Top up HSBC accounts via eDDA
One-time set up of an account top up instruction to link your same-name account(s) maintained at other selected local banks to your HSBC accounts, then you can easily transfer funds to top up your HSBC accounts directly through HSBC Online

Risk Disclosure
Currency conversion risk – the value of your foreign currency and RMB deposit will be subject to the risk of exchange rate fluctuation. If you choose to convert your foreign currency and RMB deposit to other currencies at an exchange rate that is less favourable than the exchange rate in which you made your original conversion to that foreign currency and RMB, you may suffer loss in principal.
